page.title: 01BIRKDALE GAZETTEER
page.content: Much of the area consists of farmland with a narrow residential section running between the MOSS to the South East and SANDHILLS to the North West. The residential area lies between the villages of BIRKDALE and AINSDALE and forms part of a large DORMITORY SUBURB with many of the inhabitants commuting to LIVERPOOL each day. Much of the older housing forms part of a RIBBON DEVELOPMENT alongside the main road between LIVERPOOL and SOUTHPORT. Estates of council housing were later built between the main road and the MOSS. The MOSS is INTENSIVELY farmed with ARABLE CROPS being grown and DAIRY HERDS kept. The highest point in an otherwise flat landscape is a SANDHILL 15m above SEA LEVEL.
